Inside Macintosh: Cyberdog Programmer's Kit / Part 3 - Cyberdog Reference
Chapter 7 - Classes and Methods / CyberLogExtension

IsLogWindowShown

Tests whether the log window is currently displayed.

ODBoolean IsLogWindowShown ();
return value
kODTrue if the log window is displayed; otherwise, kODFalse.
DISCUSSION
This method should determine whether the log window is currently displayed. You should not call this method directly; to determine whether the log window is displayed, you should call CyberSession::IsLogWindowShown, which calls this method.

If you subclass CyberLogExtension, you must override this method. Your override must call its inherited method.

SEE ALSO
The ShowLogWindow method (page 255).
The CyberSession::IsLogWindowShown method (page 368).
